Recap: Everyone is preparing for Gus and Harley's wedding. Gus and Harley discuss the exhumation order. Harley wonders what will happen if Phillip's body is not in there. Gus says they will deal with it together. He tells her they will know before they walk down the isle. Gus leaves the rings outside of Company and someone takes them to the tree house where Harley and Frank find them later. Blake worries when Harley is late and starts drinking. Michelle overhears the nurse talking to Danny about the baby and the forms. She takes the phone and explains she is applying for her old job and there was some confusion about Robbie's insurance. Marina goes to talk to Michelle at the hospital. Michelle is sitting at a table so Marina doesn't notice she is pregnant. Michelle tells her she still has feelings for Danny but it doesn't matter because he has moved on. Marina ends up inviting Michelle to the wedding. Michelle is thinking about going.
Transcript: Gus: So what do you say? We should act like every romantic couple on their wedding day and dig up a body.
Harley: I don't believe this. But why?
Gus: I tried to think of everything, Honey. You know, like flowers, chocolates, perfume, cash even, but I knew this is what you wanted.
Harley: You're so romantic.
Gus: Thanks.
Harley: I meant, why change your mind? Do you think there's a chance he could actually be alive?
Gus: Phillip is dead. He's only alive in Alan's warped mind, okay? But I love you and you have your doubts, right, so I want to put your doubts to rest before we take that walk and make it official.
Harley: What if Phillip isn't in there?
Gus: Then we deal with that, together. As partners, as husband and wife. But either way, you'll have peace of mind. We'll have peace of mind. What do you think?
Harley: I think that if I'm not careful, we're going to start our honeymoon in, like, 30 seconds. ( Laughter )
[SCENE_BREAK]
Buzz: Hey, steady. Steady. I want a clear shot of the handsome father of the bride.
Marina: Oh, yes. You look stunning. Simply stunning. You are glowing.

Buzz: I just love this crew. Okay, today's the big day. I just... Harley, I hope that you and Gus don't look back on this years from now and are disappointed because it's not going to be a huge, splendid... you know, a Spaulding bash or even a Greek Orthodox wedding. You know, it's going to be, you know...
Marina: More Cooper.
Buzz: Yeah. More Cooper. But you're not going to have linens or crystal, you know. Just a lot of love. Everybody loves you so much, Harley.
Marina: And Gus.

Buzz: And Gus. Yes, and Gus. In just a little while, you're both going to be standing out there, making vows to love and honor-- and I know "obey" isn't in your vocabulary-- but you're going to promise to live out your lives together. And that's... that's sacred. That's the most sacred, most right thing. It's your dad, giving his blessing.
Marina: What he said.
Buzz: All right, let's start.
Marina: Just as soon as you two lovebirds decide to get here.
Blake: Does that mean the bride and groom are together?
Buzz: I just left them.
Cassie: So much for Harley's plan.
Mel: I guess Gus finally wore her down.
Blake: Wait a minute, wait a minute. How can you be so blasé about this?
Cassie: What's the big deal, Blake? You saw Ross before your wedding, and I saw Edmund before mine.
Blake: Hello? 50/50. I don't like the odds. Let's go separate them. ( Claps ) Come on. Chop, chop.
Mel: We'll be back.
Marina: Starting to wish you had eloped?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Danny: I'm sorry, could you repeat that?
Nurse: Mr. Santos, I'm processing insurance forms for the baby.
Danny: Well, there's got to be some sort of mix-up. I don't have a baby. I have a son, but he hasn't been to the hospital in... who filled out the form?
Nurse: Your wife, Michelle Bauer Santos.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Buzz: Frank, say something nice to your sister.
Frank: Okay. Something nice.
Buzz: Frankie.

Oh, and by the way, if you're not going to be using your room, I was thinking perhaps that we might be...
Buzz: The room is mine.
Coop: Fine.
Buzz: Frankie?

Frank: Okay, Sis. I love you. From knee-high to the counter, I've always had your back, and I always will love you no matter what. Now, this new husband of yours, if he doesn't treat you right, you know where to come looking. But I don't think you're going to have to do that because, well, Gus is a good man. Not as good as I am, but he'll do. Anyway, the reason he's a good man is because he stood by you when I identified that scar on your arm, and for that I am truly sorry. And I just...
Buzz: Frank. Save your energy for the one duty you have as Best Man.
Frank: What are you talking about? I've got a lot of chores. I'm responsible for a lot of things here, Pop. You know, like, tying the cans to the back of the car, and...
Buzz: Forget about the cans. Where are they?
Frank: Don't worry, I didn't lose anything.
Buzz: Frank, show me.

Harley: So, how does it work?

Harley: When is all this going to happen?
Gus: Now. It's happening now.

Harley: ( Laughs )
Gus: Of course I do.

Gus: Nothing.

Gus: Wait a second. I haven't seen her in a long...

Blake: You go or you deal with me.

Harley: ( Laughs )
( Knocking on door )
Gus: Honey, let me in! I love you! I love you! I love you! I love you! ( Laughter )
Blake: Shut up or I'm calling security.
Gus: All right, well, if she's late, I'm holding you personally responsible, do you understand me? But I'm leaving. I'm going. Goodbye. This is me leaving. Goodbye.
Harley: I love you!
Cassie: Why are you not dressed?
Harley: What? I was going to change at Company.

Harley: Well, I mean, I'm a little messy. Nothing a brooch won't fix.
Blake: A little? A little? It's going to take, like, a half hour to work a miracle on you. That's all we have. So...
Harley: Gee, thanks Blake.
Blake: You stay silent and be like a lump of clay. Cassie, hand me the makeup bag, okay?
Harley: I kind of like the way I look.
Blake: Lump of clay.
Mel: Jerk.

Danny: Are you sure? Do you need my insurance card or anything?
Michelle: No, I'm fine. I'm fine. And actually I have to finish filling this out, so I'm going to... I'll talk to you later. Okay? All right, bye.
Rick: Hey, Michelle. What a nice surpri...
Marina: Was that Michelle?
Danny: Yeah. Sort of.
Marina: Is something wrong?

Marina: A long, boring story?

Michelle: I was going to.

Michelle: Yes. Yes.

Michelle: I know. I know.

Zach and Jude: Gus, Gus, Gus!
Gus: Hey! What's up? What's going on, Guys. We don't need no suits for no weddings, do we? No, we don't.
Zach: We're getting married for real this time.
Gus: Yes, we're getting married for real this time. That's absolutely right. Hey. You guys want to go inside and taste a little of the cake?
Jude: Yeah.
Zach: We can't, we'll get in trouble.
Gus: Oh, please. I'll show you how to do it. Remember? I showed you before. You eat it from behind. Nobody's going to notice.
Ross: All right. We want to come too, Bud.
Frank: All right.
Michelle: Look, you go. Go take care of Phillip.
Rick: In a second. We need to talk. You and me. Come on. Help me understand why you would keep something like this from me.
Michelle: Because, Rick, I didn't want anyone to know until...
Rick: Until what? When?
Michelle: Until I know who the father is.
Rick: Isn't Tony the father?
Michelle: It's possible.
Rick: What... what do you mean, "it's possible"? Who else is possible?
Michelle: Danny. Okay? And I'm not sure.
Rick: Great, great, great, great.
Michelle: And I didn't want to complicate things for him until I am.
Cop: Dr. Bauer.
Rick: That's just... yes? I'll be right there. Okay? I'm not finished with you.

Those are the questions I keep asking myself over and over again. But you know what question I haven't asked myself, the important question? How will that affect Phillip? And yeah, he lost sight of that, because he was sick, Frank. He was really, really sick. So say he's out there and he's getting better, like Alan says, and the whole crazy story is true. Doesn't he deserve the happiness that I have with Gus? Doesn't he deserve a second chance? I know I do. So say he is out there... what if he is? That's a big "If." And he's getting better, and he's getting ready to come back to us, to be a father to my son again, well, that's a good thing, isn't it, Frank? That's a wonderful thing, right?
